thread.title: Cubs fans sticking together after tough NLCS start
thread.title_full: Cubs fans sticking together after tough NLCS start

title: Cubs fans sticking together after tough NLCS start
text:
Cubs fans sticking together after tough NLCS start Posted: QUINCY, Ill. (WGEM) - 
Sunday night, Cubs fans flocked to local bars and restaurants in Quincy to watch their team try to make history. "We have been through so much pain and heart break that to see them be succesful, it means more than watching a successful team (win)," said a life long Cubs fan Aaron Smit. It has been 107 years since the Cubs last celebrated a World Series Title. "We need it to happen now. We've waited long enough," said Quincy resident Nick Niewoher. Nick Niewoher has been a Cubs fan for his entire life, just like his grandfather before him."He's on his last days and he has been a die-hard Cubs fans his entire life," said Niewoher. "But I want it more this year for my grandpa, for him to be able to see it."Though their team is down 2 games to none in the National Llague Championship Series to the Mets, these Cubs fans aren't giving up hope just yet. "It's very exciting, yet nerve racking at the same time to even see them step on the field and throw the first pitch, honestly," said Quincy resident Nick Batta.When you team has not won a championship in more than a century you at least have to have a little faith.Game three of the NLCS is Tuesday in Chicago.
